name: MimicAdmission
description: The ADMISSIONS table gives information regarding a patient’s admission to the hospital. Since each unique hospital visit for a patient is assigned a unique HADM_ID, the ADMISSIONS table can be considered as a definition table for HADM_ID. Information available includes timing information for admission and discharge, demographic information, the source of the admission, and so on.
purpose: Define a patient’s hospital admission, HADM_ID

element.short: id, which represents a single patient’s admission to the hospital.
element.definition: id, which represents a single patient’s admission to the hospital.

element.short: ADMITTIME provides the date and time the patient was admitted to the hospital
element.definition: ADMITTIME provides the date and time the patient was admitted to the hospital

element.short: DISCHTIME provides the date and time the patient was discharged from the hospital.
element.definition: DISCHTIME provides the date and time the patient was discharged from the hospital.

element.short: DEATHTIME provides the time of in-hospital death for the patient.
element.definition: DEATHTIME provides the time of in-hospital death for the patient. Note that DEATHTIME is only present if the patient died in-hospital, and is almost always the same as the patient’s DISCHTIME. However, there can be some discrepancies due to typographical errors.

element.short: ADMISSION_TYPE describes the type of the admission: ‘ELECTIVE’, ‘URGENT’, ‘NEWBORN’ or ‘EMERGENCY’.
element.definition: ADMISSION_TYPE describes the type of the admission: ‘ELECTIVE’, ‘URGENT’, ‘NEWBORN’ or ‘EMERGENCY’. Emergency/urgent indicate unplanned medical care, and are often collapsed into a single category in studies. Elective indicates a previously planned hospital admission. Newborn indicates that the HADM_ID pertains to the patient’s birth.

element.short: ADMISSION_LOCATION provides information about the previous location of the patient prior to arriving at the hospital.
element.definition: ADMISSION_LOCATION provides information about the previous location of the patient prior to arriving at the hospital.

element.short: Time that the patient was registered from the emergency department.
element.definition: Time that the patient was registered from the emergency department.

element.short: Time that the patient was discharged from the emergency department.
element.definition: Time that the patient was discharged from the emergency department.

element.short: The DIAGNOSIS column provides a preliminary, free text diagnosis for the patient on hospital admission.
element.definition: The DIAGNOSIS column provides a preliminary, free text diagnosis for the patient on hospital admission.The diagnosis is usually assigned by the admitting clinician and does not use a systematic ontology.
